properties.title: Mosaïques romaines d’Orbe-Boscéaz
properties.abstract: The most beautiful set of Roman mosaics north of the Alps was unearthed on the Boscéaz site near Orbe. These unique vestiges of a luxurious villa represent figurative scenes and geometrical patterns.
properties.description: Five pavilions protect the site containing the largest set of Roman mosaics in Switzerland. The site is located in Boscéaz near Orbe, a small medieval town in the Yverdon-les-Bains region. The mosaics, which were discovered in the mid-19th century, adorned 9 of the 100 rooms of a huge and luxurious Gallo-Roman villa built towards 160 A.D. The villa was destroyed during the invasions and the grounds were used as a quarry in the Middle Ages. No above-ground structures remain.
